entry.title: Incident: Errors when accessing Slack
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On February 21 between 7:00am PT to 9:20am PT, some users experienced connectivity issues with Slack.
The connectivity issue arose from a misconfiguration that was discovered by our engineers. At 8:45am PT a change in the configuration led to users being able to successfully connect to Slack again.
We’re hard at work on scoping preventative measures to ensure this doesn’t happen again in the future.

The connectivity issue arose from a misconfiguration that was discovered by our engineers. At 8:45am PT a change in the configuration led to users being able to successfully connect to Slack again. We’re hard at work on scoping preventative measures to ensure this doesn’t happen again in the future.

entry.title: Incident: Delayed push notifications
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On February 21st at 4:22PM PST, we deployed a database change, which caused unexpected delays for processes such as notifications and link/image previews in Slack. The problem was identified and corrected, however a backlog of notifications and previews had formed in the meantime. We continued to monitor this backlog after the fix was implemented, and by 5:20PM PST, all functionality returned to normal.

We continued to monitor this backlog after the fix was implemented, and by 5:20PM PST, all functionality returned to normal.

entry.title: Outage: Issues with mobile notifications for some Grid customers
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On February 15th at 12:30 PM PT, a database change was deployed to help us move to a new system. The change in systems resulted in push notifications not being delivered for some Grid customers. Between February 15th and 19th, we received reports of missing notifications from Grid customers which were attributed to a bug and further investigated. On February 19th, our team identified the root issue affecting Grid customers and reverted the deploy. By 6:30 PM PT the revert had been fully deployed and push notifications were working normally again.
We’re very sorry to those affected for the disruption. We’re investigating the root cause and making plans to ensure this doesn’t happen in the future.

On February 19th, our team identified the root issue affecting Grid customers and reverted the deploy. We’re investigating the root cause and making plans to ensure this doesn’t happen in the future.

If you have any further hassles, please reach out to us at feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: Incident: Emails to Slack not working
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On February 13th at 5:02pm PST, we received reports that emails were failing to deliver to Slack forwarding addresses. We identified that this was the result of an expired certificate used to verify requests sent from our email provider. At 7:20pm PST, we deployed an update to address this. We identified that emails sent as early as 12:07pm PST may have been affected by this issue. Unfortunately, any emails sent via the integration during this time would not have been successful. However, they can now be manually re-sent.
entry.content:
10:19pm PST - Technical Summary: On February 13th at 5:02pm PST, we received reports that emails were failing to deliver to Slack forwarding addresses. We identified that this was the result of an expired certificate used to verify requests sent from our email provider. At 7:20pm PST, we deployed an update to address this. We identified that emails sent as early as 12:07pm PST may have been affected by this issue. Unfortunately, any emails sent via the integration during this time would not have been successful. However, they can now be manually re-sent.

7:28pm PST - We're happy to say that emails to Slack should be working once again. Thanks for sticking with us and if you see any other troubles, please reach out through feedback@slack.com.

7:13pm PST - We don't have any new information on the email integration issue, but we're continuing our efforts to fix it. We really appreciate your patience.

entry.title: Incident: Customers unable to send messages through the API
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On February 5th at 4:29PM to 4:56PM PST, some customers were not able to send messages through Slack's API.
At 4:29PM PST, we deployed a change which affected caching for our Slack API apps resulting in a database becoming unavailable. This caused some messages sent via the API to fail. At 4:56 PM PST we deployed a revert for the change and resolved the issue.
If you notice any further issues with sending messages through the API, please let us know at feedback@slack.com.

At 4:29PM PST, we deployed a change which affected caching for our Slack API apps resulting in a database becoming unavailable. This caused some messages sent via the API to fail. At 4:56 PM PST we deployed a revert for the change and resolved the issue. If you notice any further issues with sending messages through the API, please let us know at feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: Incident: Some Android app users may be unable to sign in with their identity providers on Grid
entry.summary: On January 30 at 8:40 PM PST, we internally detected an issue where customers were unable to sign into the Android app through Single Sign-On. Upon investigation, we determined that the issue was related to a recent browser release. On February 1 at 3:29 PM PST, we implemented a fix, so all customers should now be able to sign into Slack on their Android devices. If you are still having trouble, please let us know at feedback@slack.com.
entry.content:
6:03pm PST - On January 30 at 8:40 PM PST, we internally detected an issue where customers were unable to sign into the Android app through Single Sign-On. Upon investigation, we determined that the issue was related to a recent browser release. On February 1 at 3:29 PM PST, we implemented a fix, so all customers should now be able to sign into Slack on their Android devices. If you are still having trouble, please let us know at feedback@slack.com.

4:05pm PST - Thanks so much for your patience while our team addressed these issues with sign in on Android users. Everything should be working as it should once again, but if you run into trouble, please let us know at feedback@slack.com.

12:06am PST - We believe to have narrowed the issue down to users on Chrome version 72. We do however have a workaround for the meantime. If you’re facing this problem, please try the following steps: 1. Open a mobile web browser and navigate to your workspace URL 2. Tap 'Sign in with [your identity provider]' 3. Enter your username and password, then sign in 4. Once signed in, tap 'Open Slack' under 'Have the app already?' to launch your workspace

entry.title: Incident: Some customers having trouble searching
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
From 6:24PM to 6:46PM PT, some customers were not able to complete search requests in Slack.
An internal proxy server that was stuck caused the search service to get caught in a bad state, resulting in customers being unable to search in Slack.
We restarted the service, which fixed searches for all customers. The all clear was called at 6:46PM PT.
If you notice any further issues with searching, please do let us know at feedback@slack.com.

An internal proxy server that was stuck caused the search service to get caught in a bad state, resulting in customers being unable to search in Slack. We restarted the service, which fixed searches for all customers. The all clear was called at 6:46PM PT. If you notice any further issues with searching, please do let us know at feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: Incident: Some Android users are not receiving notifications
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On January 7th, 2019 PT the execution of a weekly cleanup job errantly caused some Android users to be unable to receive notifications to their mobile devices.
We manually reverted the errant changes made by the cleanup job, and by January 15th at 3:32pm Pacific Time all notification functionality was restored.
entry.content:
8:49pm PST - Technical Summary: On January 7th, 2019 PT the execution of a weekly cleanup job errantly caused some Android users to be unable to receive notifications to their mobile devices. We manually reverted the errant changes made by the cleanup job, and by January 15th at 3:32pm Pacific Time all notification functionality was restored.

4:11pm PST - Folks should now be receiving push notifications on Android. If you're still not receiving push notifications, please drop us a line at feedback@slack.com. Thanks for your patience!

2:44pm PST - We’re still investigating notification issues on Android; however, we’ve received reports from folks who have had success with the steps below. 1. Open your phone’s recently active app list, dismiss the Slack app from the list, and relaunch the app. 2. Navigate into the app’s Settings > Notification Settings section and tap Troubleshoot notifications. 3. If you don’t see a test notification appear at the end of the test, please back out into the app’s main Settings page, scroll down, and tap Advanced > Reset Cache. Please reach out to feedback@slack.com if you’re still having trouble receiving notifications.

1:30pm PST - We’re still working to fix the push notification problems that have been impacting Android users. We hope to have the issue fully resolved as soon as possible.

entry.title: Incident: Slackbot is not responding to messages written in Japanese
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On Jan 14th at 12:46 PM PST, a code change was made to how Slackbot fetches Help Center articles. Customers with locales set to Japanese failed to get proper responses in their DM with Slackbot. Instead, they were sent the generic error "何を言われたかわかりませんでした。ごめんなさい" ("I'm sorry, I don't understand!")
We deployed a fix for the issue at 2:00 PM PT on Jan 16th and restored Slackbot's functionality for all users.

We deployed a fix for the issue at 2:00 PM PT on Jan 16th and restored Slackbot's functionality for all users.

entry.title: Incident: Problems with email previews in Slack
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On December 26th at 2:32 PM PST, we discovered that a small percentage of emails forwarded into some workspaces using our Email Ingestion feature were appearing blank. After investigating the issue, it was determined that the process responsible for handling these emails was occasionally failing and returning an empty file. A change was made to detect and retry the processing of any emails received in this state, and the Email Ingestion feature returned to full operation on December 28th at 1:43 PM PST.
entry.content:
7:28am PST - Technical Summary: On December 26th at 2:32 PM PST, we discovered that a small percentage of emails forwarded into some workspaces using our Email Ingestion feature were appearing blank. After investigating the issue, it was determined that the process responsible for handling these emails was occasionally failing and returning an empty file. A change was made to detect and retry the processing of any emails received in this state, and the Email Ingestion feature returned to full operation on December 28th at 1:43 PM PST.

1:52pm PST - We've resolved the issue with email previews in Slack and they should now be displaying as expected. Thanks for bearing with us. If you continue to experience any trouble, please reach out to us at feedback@slack.com for further assistance.

entry.title: Incident: Folks using our API are receiving invalid_auth errors
entry.summary:
Between 10:34am to 10:52 am PT today, users of our API were receiving invalid_auth errors when making a request to a range of API methods. We noticed that both bot and user tokens were being used to call various methods of our API. These requests were being erroneously rejected with the invalid_token error due to a database issue.
We have since fixed the issue. Thank you for hanging in there, and our apologies for any inconvenience.
entry.content: 10:34am PST - Between 10:34am to 10:52 am PT today, users of our API were receiving invalid_auth errors when making a request to a range of API methods. We noticed that both bot and user tokens were being used to call various methods of our API. These requests were being erroneously rejected with the invalid_token error due to a database issue. We have since fixed the issue. Thank you for hanging in there, and our apologies for any inconvenience.

entry.title: Incident: File uploads failing for some users on iOS
entry.summary:
On January 4th at 1:59 pm PT, we changed a feature flag that would make uploads faster and more reliable for customers using iOS, specifically for those outside North America. After some investigation, it was determined that some iOS customers were not correctly switching over to the new functionality. This caused some users to experience failures when trying to uploads files on iOS.
We deployed a change to fix the issue, and customers were able to successfully upload files again on their iOS devices as of January 6th, at 8:34 pm PT.
Thanks for your patience as we worked through the issue. We’re making plans to ensure this doesn’t happen in the future.

After some investigation, it was determined that some iOS customers were not correctly switching over to the new functionality. This caused some users to experience failures when trying to uploads files on iOS. We deployed a change to fix the issue, and customers were able to successfully upload files again on their iOS devices as of January 6th, at 8:34 pm PT. Thanks for your patience as we worked through the issue. We’re making plans to ensure this doesn’t happen in the future.

entry.title: Incident: Degraded search and workspace management services for some customers

entry.title: Incident: Calls on mobile not working for some customers in Asia
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
Earlier in the day, on December 10th, our Singapore calls server was temporarily taken out of action for some scheduled maintenance.
This exposed an existing bug in the calls API that had been re-routing calls originating from India and Japan to our Singapore calls server. With this server now offline, we started to receive reports from those regions of calls via mobile failing. At 9:19pm PT, we put a fix in place, and calls began to no longer fail on mobile devices.
Calls from these regions should now be working as expected. However, if you notice anything amiss, please contact us at feedback@slack.com.

With this server now offline, we started to receive reports from those regions of calls via mobile failing. At 9:19pm PT, we put a fix in place, and calls began to no longer fail on mobile devices. Calls from these regions should now be working as expected. However, if you notice anything amiss, please contact us at feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: Incident: Slack imports are not importing messages into channels successfully
entry.summary:
Technical summary:
On November 29th at 9:03am PT, we made a change that restructured how we filter channels IDs during imports. This had a negative effect on the import tool, and we failed to retrieve public channel messages from the export file during Slack to Slack imports.
After identifying the problem, our team deployed a fix at 10:40pm PT. Going forward, all new imports are now working as expected. If, however, you do experience any issues, please let us know at feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: Incident: Slow unfurls being experienced by all users.
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On November 28th between 1:10pm (PT) and 4:33pm (PT), some customers experienced delays with parts of our service.
An issue occurred at 1:10pm (PT) that triggered a high amount of API calls, creating a backlog in one of our job queues. This caused delays for some customers with features that rely on the job queue, including unfurls, Slackbot messages, and "All Threads" or "All Unreads".
We worked through the backlog and deployed a fix which allowed the job queue to recover. The all clear was called at 1:38pm (PT).

entry.title: Incident: Some customers are unable to use search in their Administration pages
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On November 19th at approximately 07:46 AM PT our team internally identified a server that manages user-related information which was no longer serving requests in a timely manner. This affected a subset of users, and caused the Admin pages to not load properly. As a result, customers were not able to manage team members. We received the first reports from our customers at 08:54am PT, during this time our team was actively investigating the root cause of the issue.
A few contributing factors led to this incident, including a new feature that relied on the fetching and loading of user-groups and how it the functioned with the auto-complete modal. Our team worked to reduce the strain on the server which hosts user-related information. From there, we were able to deploy a fix, stabilizing the affected server at 04:07 PM PT. An official All-Clear was called at 04:45 PM PT on November 20th.
We’re sorry for the disruption to your work day. If you are still experiencing issues with managing team members, please drop us a line at feedback@slack.com

entry.title: Incident: Connectivity troubles
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On November 19, 2018 between 05:12 am PT and 06:00 am PT, a small percentage of our users were unable to connect to Slack.
The connection issue was caused when a single Point of Presence (POP) failed to respond to requests to slack.com. Requests going through that specific POP were either delayed or timed out, which resulted in our users being unable to connect to their workspace, or experiencing slowness in Slack. We worked with our cloud provider to remove this POP from our distribution, and resolved the issue at 06:08 am.

entry.title: Incident: Some people having trouble deleting private channels
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On November 13th, 2018 between 2:29 PM (PT) and 5:39 PM (PT) customers were unable to delete private channels if they were previously converted from public channels.
We made a change at 2:29 PM (PT) that affected how we check for token types and scopes in our API in relation to private channels. This introduced a bug that prevented customers from deleting these private channels. The change was reverted at 5:39 PM (PT).
To those affected, we are truly sorry for interrupting your day and are working hard to make sure this doesn't happen again.
If you notice any further issues with deleting channels please do let us know at feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: Incident: Connectivity issues in Europe
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On November 7th at 12:17 AM (PT), we began experiencing issues that prevented some users in Europe from successfully connecting to their workspaces over the course of two days.
These connectivity problems were caused by unexpected resource limitations in two European data centers.
We have been working with our upstream service provider, AWS, to understand why this has been isolated to these two regions. In order to reduce disconnections, we have performed the following mitigation steps:
• We have deployed additional hardware into the pool to distribute connections across more machines.
• We have converted one of these regions to work across multiple availability zones, which was done before the beginning of Europe's workday on November 9th.
• AWS has put a mitigation in place for the load balancers.
We are deeply sorry for the disruption this has caused to your workdays. Please let us know if you are still experiencing any connectivity issues at feedback@slack.com.

In order to reduce disconnections, we have performed the following mitigation steps: • We have deployed additional hardware into the pool to distribute connections across more machines. • We have converted one of these regions to work across multiple availability zones, which was done before the beginning of Europe's workday on November 9th. • AWS has put a mitigation in place for the load balancers. We are deeply sorry for the disruption this has caused to your workdays. Please let us know if you are still experiencing any connectivity issues at feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: Incident: Degraded functionality
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On October 22nd, at approximately 8:37 PM PT, we experienced a small network issue which caused one of our servers to disconnect. This affected the queue that hosts user actions and core functionalities, ranging from push notifications to managing team members. A small subset of our customers experienced degraded functionality during this time.
Our team worked to ensure that we had a plan to resolve the issue, and this was completed by 10:50 PM PT on October 23rd. We continued to monitor the situation, and finally declared the incident fully clear at 11:34 PM PT.
We’re investigating the root cause, as well as making plans to ensure this doesn’t happen in the future.

entry.title: Incident: Slack is experiencing degraded service

entry.title: Incident: Users experiencing slowness in the app
entry.summary:
Technical Summary
On October 18, 2018 at 4 PM PT, we identified a bug in how we were handling accounts being added to IDP groups. This resulted in the deactivation of some user accounts from their workspaces. This also removed their associated integrations, and archived many private channels.
We quickly reverted a code change, and began restoring the affected user accounts, private channels and integrations back to their previous states.
At 5:06 PM PT, we noticed that some servers were overloaded as a result of the restoration efforts we made. This meant that some customers were unable to connect to Slack. We monitored the situation as the server recovered. At 7:41 PM PT, our engineers confirmed functionality was restored for all customers.
On October 19 at 4:32 PM PT, we fully resolved the provisioning issue. Customers who were affected by this issue needed to reload Slack to regain access to their workspaces. We’re continuing to investigate the root cause of these issues to ensure this doesn’t happen in the future.

entry.title: Incident: Problems with adding Google Calendar to Slack
entry.summary:

On September 18th at 12:42am PT, we noticed that people were having trouble installing the Google Calendar app. Once we detected the issue, we began an internal investigation.
At 04:52am PT on September 19th, our engineers identified a change in Google’s authentication API as the root cause of the problem. Once we assessed the impact, we made a change and we were able to call an all clear at 07:47 AM PT. If you are still experiencing issues with the Google Calendar app, please email us at feedback@slack.com.

entry.title: Incident: Connectivity issues affecting some users
entry.summary:
Technical summary:
On September 12th from 9:59pm to 10:18pm Pacific Time, a few hundred people were not able to do connect to Slack.
A network event between servers in Slack’s central data centers caused normal login attempts to fail in such a way that people’s Slack clients retried aggressively. These retries were rate-limited by Slack’s servers in order to protect themselves. As soon as the network event was resolved by our data center provider, and as soon as rate limits allowed, people were once again able to connect to Slack.
The all clear was called at 11:05pm Pacific Time, after prolonged observation of network conditions.

These retries were rate-limited by Slack’s servers in order to protect themselves. As soon as the network event was resolved by our data center provider, and as soon as rate limits allowed, people were once again able to connect to Slack. The all clear was called at 11:05pm Pacific Time, after prolonged observation of network conditions.

10:18pm PDT - Everyone should be able to connect to Slack again. If you have any further trouble, please reach out at feedback@slack.com. We really appreciate your patience as we worked through this.

10:14pm PDT - We're still digging in to this, but things are beginning to look up. Thank you for bearing with us.

entry.title: Notice: Slack’s forwarding email feature is failing for some customers
entry.summary:

On September 7th at 2:35pm PT, we received reports that emails were failing to deliver to Slack forwarding addresses. We identified that this was the result of an expired certificate used to verify requests sent from our email provider. At 4:55pm PT, we deployed an update that corrected this and fixed the problem. Unfortunately any email sent to a forwarding address during this time is not retrievable and will need to be resent.

entry.title: Outage: Some people are having trouble connecting to Slack, we're working on it.
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
From 11:15am to 11:28am PT, 100% of customers were not able to use Slack.
A deploy to our webapp to enable a feature for how we handle incoming connection requests referenced a function which wasn’t present in a specific file. This missing function caused all incoming requests to fail, returning connection errors to our users.
We rolled back that change for all users at 11:26am. Users were able to receive responses from our app again by 11:28am.

Users were able to receive responses from our app again by 11:28am.

entry.title: Outage: Connectivity issues
entry.summary:
Technical Summary 18/09/07:
At 4:38pm PT on September 6th, 2018, a change was deployed to Slack which prevented the majority of logged in users from viewing messages and stopped approximately 6.74% of users from logging in to Slack altogether.
The change that was added increased the load on one of our databases, which eventually failed. At 4:53pm PT we reverted the changes and within five minutes users were able to begin using Slack again. We were officially “all clear” by 5:01pm PT.

We were officially “all clear” by 5:01pm PT.

entry.title: Incident: Some customers may experience trouble making Slack Calls from mobile
entry.summary:
Technical Summary
On August 28th, 2018 between 6:28pmPDT and 9:24pmPDT, Slack users in the APAC region were unable to initiate a Slack call on a mobile device.
At 6:28pmPDT, we retained an out-of-date DNS record during a routine infrastructure change. This prevented Slack Calls from mobile devices in APAC from connecting with the up-to-date infastructure settings.
At 9:24pmPDT we manually removed the errant record and immediately resolved the issue. We’re currently working on preventative measures to avoid repeats of this scenario.

This prevented Slack Calls from mobile devices in APAC from connecting with the up-to-date infastructure settings. At 9:24pmPDT we manually removed the errant record and immediately resolved the issue. We’re currently working on preventative measures to avoid repeats of this scenario.

9:36pm PDT - We're back to smooth sailing! We've resolved the Calls trouble and you should now be able to make Slack Calls from Android and iOS as normal. Thank you for bearing with us.

entry.title: Outage: Connectivity issues affecting all workspaces
entry.summary:
Technical Summary:
On August 28, 2018 between 10:15amPDT and 10:59amPDT, Slack experienced a 44-minute outage where all users were unable to establish new connections to the Slack service. Users who were already connected to the service were able to remain connected during this time.
A configuration change at 10:15amPDT accessed incorrect settings and prevented service access for new connections. We reverted the configuration change at 10:59amPDT and new connections to the service were able to resume. We called the all clear at 11:23amPDT.
We are currently hard at work to scope preventative measures to ensure this does not happen in the future.

A configuration change at 10:15amPDT accessed incorrect settings and prevented service access for new connections. We reverted the configuration change at 10:59amPDT and new connections to the service were able to resume. We called the all clear at 11:23amPDT.
